repnme.cdata!:
Hungary - Energy Development and
            Conservation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Energy Development and
            Conservation Project for Hungary were as follows: outcomes
            were highly satisfactory, project sustainability was likely,
            Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was also highly satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: i) financial covenants should be used
            flexibly enough, so that, under a changing
            financial/business environment, they can be revised
            expeditiously in order not to create unnecessary
            difficulties; ii) the Bank should have alerted the
            authorities at an early stage regarding the inadequate basis
            for pricing natural gas at the well head under the present
            regulatory framework; iii) when a Borrower is really
            motivated to undertake reforms, these can be achieved over a
            relatively short time span provided that the external
            environment is also favorable; and iv) the project was a
            proper vehicle to introduce policy reforms and operational
            concepts as used by international oil companies. However the
            Bank should not have pursued broader sectoral pricing
            objectives (beyond oil and gas) under a petroleum project.
            These covenants proved unenforceable.

repnme.cdata!:
Hungary - Energy Development and
            Conservation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Energy Development
            and Conservation Project are to support: (i) improvements in
            the policy and institutional framework of the energy sector;
            (ii) development of the oil and gas sector; and (iii)
            preparation of an updated energy conservation program. The
            project is composed of two loans. First, a loan to the
            Hungarian National Oil and Gas Trust (OKGT) to finance the
            direct convertible currency component of investment
            subprojects for oil and gas field development, upgrading and
            enhanced recovery, underground gas storage, pipeline
            expansion and modernization. Also, the loan will finance
            exploration and production equipment and technical
            assistance. The seond loan is to the National Bank of
            Hungary (NBH) to finance energy conservation subprojects
            through participating commercial banks in continuation of
            the ongoing lines of credit for this purpose.
